snippet: The case centers on the wide variety and personal nature of information on today’s smartphones.
abstract: Supreme Court agrees to hear a pair of cases about whether the police need a warrant to search the cellphones of people they arrest, presenting a major test of the meaning of the Fourth Amendment in the digital age.
lead_paragraph: The case centers on the wide variety and personal nature of information on today’s smartphones.

headline.main: Supreme Court Will Consider Whether Police Need Warrants to Search Cellphones
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Will Consider Whether Police Need Warrants to Search Cellphones
